verses.verse: And the famine<WH7458> was sore<WH3515> in the land<WH776>.

And it came to pass, when they had eaten up<WH3615> <WH398> the corn<WH7668> which they had brought out<WH935> of Egypt<WH4714>, their father<WH1> said<WH559> unto them, Go again<WH7725>, buy<WH7666> us a little<WH4592> food<WH400>.

And Judah<WH3063> spake<WH559> unto him, saying<WH559>, The man<WH376> did solemnly<WH5749> protest<WH5749> unto us, saying<WH559>, Ye shall not see<WH7200> my face<WH6440>, except<WH1115> your brother<WH251> be with you. did: Heb. protesting protested
If thou wilt<WH3426> send<WH7971> our brother<WH251> with us, we will go down<WH3381> and buy<WH7666> thee food<WH400>:
But if thou wilt not send<WH7971> him, we will not go down<WH3381>: for the man<WH376> said<WH559> unto us, Ye shall not see<WH7200> my face<WH6440>, except your brother<WH251> be with you.
And Israel<WH3478> said<WH559>, Wherefore dealt ye so ill<WH7489> with me, as to tell<WH5046> the man<WH376> whether ye had yet a brother<WH251>?

And they said<WH559>, The man<WH376> asked<WH7592> us straitly<WH7592> of our state, and of our kindred<WH4138>, saying<WH559>, Is your father<WH1> yet alive<WH2416>? have ye<WH3426> another brother<WH251>? and we told<WH5046> him according<WH5921> to the tenor<WH6310> of these words<WH1697>: could we certainly<WH3045> know<WH3045> that he would say<WH559>, Bring<WH3381> your brother<WH251> down<WH3381>? asked: Heb. asking asked us tenor: Heb. mouth could: Heb. knowing could we know

And Judah<WH3063> said<WH559> unto Israel<WH3478> his father<WH1>, Send<WH7971> the lad<WH5288> with me, and we will arise<WH6965> and go<WH3212>; that we may live<WH2421>, and not die<WH4191>, both we, and thou, and also our little ones<WH2945>.

I will be surety<WH6148> for him; of my hand<WH3027> shalt thou require<WH1245> him: if<WH518> I bring<WH935> him not<WH518> unto thee, and set<WH3322> him before thee<WH6440>, then let me bear the blame<WH2398> for ever<WH3117>:
For except<WH3884> we had lingered<WH4102>, surely now we had returned<WH7725> this second time<WH6471>. this: or, twice by this

And their father<WH1> Israel<WH3478> said<WH559> unto them, If it must be so now<WH645>, do<WH6213> this; take<WH3947> of the best fruits<WH2173> in the land<WH776> in your vessels<WH3627>, and carry down<WH3381> the man<WH376> a present<WH4503>, a little<WH4592> balm<WH6875>, and a little<WH4592> honey<WH1706>, spices<WH5219>, and myrrh<WH3910>, nuts<WH992>, and almonds<WH8247>:

And take<WH3947> double<WH4932> money<WH3701> in your hand<WH3027>; and the money<WH3701> that was brought again<WH7725> in the mouth<WH6310> of your sacks<WH572>, carry it again<WH7725> in your hand<WH3027>; peradventure it was an oversight<WH4870>:
Take<WH3947> also your brother<WH251>, and arise<WH6965>, go again<WH7725> unto the man<WH376>:

And God<WH410> Almighty<WH7706> give<WH5414> you mercy<WH7356> before<WH6440> the man<WH376>, that he may send away<WH7971> your other<WH312> brother<WH251>, and Benjamin<WH1144>. If<WH834> I be bereaved<WH7921> of my children, I am bereaved<WH7921>. If: or, And I, as I have been, etc.

And the men<WH582> took<WH3947> that<WH2063> present<WH4503>, and they took<WH3947> double<WH4932> money<WH3701> in their hand<WH3027>, and Benjamin<WH1144>; and rose up<WH6965>, and went down<WH3381> to Egypt<WH4714>, and stood<WH5975> before<WH6440> Joseph<WH3130>.

And when Joseph<WH3130> saw<WH7200> Benjamin<WH1144> with<WH854> them, he said<WH559> to the ruler of his house<WH1004>, Bring<WH935> these men<WH582> home<WH1004>, and slay<WH2873> <WH2874>, and make ready<WH3559>; for these men<WH582> shall dine<WH398> with me at noon<WH6672>. slay: Heb. kill a killing dine: Heb. eat
And the man<WH376> did<WH6213> as Joseph<WH3130> bade<WH559>; and the man<WH376> brought<WH935> the men<WH582> into Joseph's<WH3130> house<WH1004>.

And the men<WH582> were afraid<WH3372>, because they were brought<WH935> into Joseph's<WH3130> house<WH1004>; and they said<WH559>, Because<WH1697> of the money<WH3701> that was returned<WH7725> in our sacks<WH572> at the first time<WH8462> are we brought in<WH935>; that he may seek occasion<WH1556> against us, and fall<WH5307> upon us, and take<WH3947> us for bondmen<WH5650>, and our asses<WH2543>. seek: Heb. roll himself upon us
And they came near<WH5066> to the steward<WH376> of Joseph's<WH3130> house<WH1004>, and they communed<WH1696> with him at the door<WH6607> of the house<WH1004>,
And said<WH559>, O<WH994> sir<WH113>, we came indeed<WH3381> down<WH3381> at the first time<WH8462> to buy<WH7666> food<WH400>: we: Heb. coming down we came down

And it came to pass, when we came<WH935> to the inn<WH4411>, that we opened<WH6605> our sacks<WH572>, and, behold, every man's<WH376> money<WH3701> was in the mouth<WH6310> of his sack<WH572>, our money<WH3701> in full weight<WH4948>: and we have brought it again<WH7725> in our hand<WH3027>.
And other<WH312> money<WH3701> have we brought down<WH3381> in our hands<WH3027> to buy<WH7666> food<WH400>: we cannot tell<WH3045> who put<WH7760> our money<WH3701> in our sacks<WH572>.

And he said<WH559>, Peace<WH7965> be to you, fear<WH3372> not: your God<WH430>, and the God<WH430> of your father<WH1>, hath given<WH5414> you treasure<WH4301> in your sacks<WH572>: I had<WH935> your money<WH3701>. And he brought<WH3318> Simeon<WH8095> out unto them. I had: Heb. your money came to me

And the man<WH376> brought<WH935> the men<WH582> into Joseph's<WH3130> house<WH1004>, and gave<WH5414> them water<WH4325>, and they washed<WH7364> their feet<WH7272>; and he gave<WH5414> their asses<WH2543> provender<WH4554>.
And they made ready<WH3559> the present<WH4503> against<WH5704> Joseph<WH3130> came<WH935> at noon<WH6672>: for they heard<WH8085> that they should eat<WH398> bread<WH3899> there.

And when Joseph<WH3130> came<WH935> home<WH1004>, they brought<WH935> him the present<WH4503> which was in their hand<WH3027> into the house<WH1004>, and bowed<WH7812> themselves to him to the earth<WH776>.

And he asked<WH7592> them of their welfare<WH7965>, and said<WH559>, Is your father<WH1> well<WH7965>, the old man<WH2205> of whom ye spake<WH559>? Is he yet alive<WH2416>? welfare: Heb. peace Is your: Heb. Is there peace to your father?
And they answered<WH559>, Thy servant<WH5650> our father<WH1> is in good health<WH7965>, he is yet alive<WH2416>. And they bowed down their heads<WH6915>, and made obeisance<WH7812>.

And he lifted up<WH5375> his eyes<WH5869>, and saw<WH7200> his brother<WH251> Benjamin<WH1144>, his mother's<WH517> son<WH1121>, and said<WH559>, Is this your younger<WH6996> brother<WH251>, of whom ye spake<WH559> unto me? And he said<WH559>, God<WH430> be gracious<WH2603> unto thee, my son<WH1121>.

And Joseph<WH3130> made haste<WH4116>; for his bowels<WH7356> did yearn<WH3648> upon his brother<WH251>: and he sought<WH1245> where to weep<WH1058>; and he entered<WH935> into his chamber<WH2315>, and wept<WH1058> there.
And he washed<WH7364> his face<WH6440>, and went out<WH3318>, and refrained<WH662> himself, and said<WH559>, Set on<WH7760> bread<WH3899>.

And they set on<WH7760> for him by himself, and for them by themselves, and for the Egyptians<WH4713>, which did eat<WH398> with him, by themselves: because the Egyptians<WH4713> might<WH3201> not eat<WH398> bread<WH3899> with the Hebrews<WH5680>; for that is an abomination<WH8441> unto the Egyptians<WH4714>.

And they sat<WH3427> before him<WH6440>, the firstborn<WH1060> according to his birthright<WH1062>, and the youngest<WH6810> according to his youth<WH6812>: and the men<WH582> marvelled<WH8539> one<WH376> at another<WH7453>.

And he took<WH5375> and sent messes<WH4864> unto them from before him<WH6440>: but Benjamin's<WH1144> mess<WH4864> was five<WH2568> times<WH3027> so much as<WH7235> any of theirs. And they drank<WH8354>, and were merry<WH7937> with him. were: Heb. drank largely
